msDesc.head: Miscellaneous works on Sufism and prayers, 88 items (a-cj)

msContents.summary: Miscellany or majmūʿah of sūrahs from the Qurʾān, extracts or complete ritual and elective supplications accompanied by Persian annotations, traditions of prophets and imams, litanies, eulogies and other poems, moralist anecdotes, magic squares and talismans, medicinal recipes, and genealogies of the Chishtī and Qādirī Sufi orders, written by or for a Sufi or Sunnī religious officiate (possibly Shaykh ʿAbd al-Ṣamad Ṣiddīqī) over the course of several years, without particular order, for private use. Though damaged, the volume illustrates the range and depth of traditional and esoteric knowledge required in late-eighteenth-century India. Volume not dated; datable to late eighteenth century. Multiple hands ranging from neat to rough shikastah āmīz, several varieties of naskh occasionally merging with bihārī script. Traces of dense Devanagari text transmitted in reverse (ff. 13v-14r, 22v-23r). Papers covered with densely flecked silver (ff. 12v-13r, 14v, 21r, 22v-23r), with clusters of sheets sparsely flecked with silver encountered further on (ff. 73v-74r, 75v-76r, 77v-78v, 79v-80r). Floral motif in grey pigment sparsely stamped over the text (ff. 71v-72r, 81v). Numerous lacunae. Annotations in margins. Not foliated. Lacking original binding. Binding damaged (combed marble paper with brown leather edging over pasteboards), labels. Folios mostly bound; cropped, wormholes, later repairs. Tinted papers. Folios covered with densely flecked silver. Condition fragile.

note.p: Untitled Arabic prayer followed by notes in Persian explaining its prescription by Imām Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq for curing fever or tap.
This is followed by a note on hastening the betrothal of daughters.
Persian notes introducing an untitled prayer partially in Persian and Arabic attributed to Shaykh Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Gīlānī (d. 561/1166).

Persian notes introducing an untitled prayer partially in Persian and Arabic attributed to a Muḥyī al-Dīn Abū Muḥammad [ibn] Ṣāliḥ Jīlānī, a reference to Shaykh Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Gīlānī (d. 561/1166).
Persian notes introducing a short untitled Arabic prayer for ʿĪd al-Fiṭr.
Persian notes introducing a short untitled talismanic Arabic prayer against illness.
This is followed by further notes.
Persian notes introducing an untitled Arabic prayer revealed in a dream to an unnamed Qāz̤ī from Baghdad.
Persian notes introducing an untitled Arabic prayer for good fortune.
Persian notes introducing the virtues of a brief untitled Arabic prayer revealed to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Papers covered with densely flecked silver (ff. 12v-13r, 14v).
Traces of dense Devanagari text transmitted in reverse (ff. 13v-14r).
Paper covered with densely flecked silver (f. 21r).
Persian notes introducing the virtues of a brief untitled Arabic prayer for the needy favoured by the Sufi Shaykh Shihāb al-Dīn [Suhravardī].
Papers covered with densely flecked silver (ff. 21r, 22v). Traces of dense Devanagari text transmitted in reverse (f. 22v).
Papers covered with densely flecked silver (ff. 22v-23r). Traces of dense Devanagari text transmitted in reverse (ff. 22v-23r).
Untitled Persian note on a tradition or ḥadīs̲ of the Prophet Muḥammad.
Persian notes introducing the virtues of a brief untitled Arabic prayer for forgiveness.

Persian notes discussing the virtues of the Arabic basmalah invocation from the Qurʾān mentioned in the Khulāṣat al-akhbār, probably a reference to the compendious history by Ghiyās̲ al-Dīn Khvāndamīr ibn Humām al-Dīn (d. 942/1535).
Awkward naskh hand combined with nastaʿlīq.
This followed by two short Persian notes on the curing of pain and a talismanic formula restoring fecundity to a miscarrying woman.
Lengthy untitled Arabic eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
This followed by a short Persian note on an additional prayer.
Untitled genealogy or nasab'nāmah of Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Jīlānī.
Incomplete fragment of the untitled Arabic spiritual genealogy of the Chishtīyah Sufi Order.
Arabic tradition or ḥadīs̲ of the Prophet Muḥammad.
Untitled eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Untitled Arabic prayer introduced with a brief note in Persian.
Lengthy untitled Arabic eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Floral motif in grey pigment sparsely stamped over the text (ff. 71v-72r).
Untitled Arabic eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Papers covered with sparsely flecked silver (ff. 73v-74r, 75v-76r).
Untitled eulogy or manqabat to Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Jīlānī.
Papers covered with sparsely flecked silver (ff. 77v-78v, 79v-80r).
Floral motif in grey pigment sparsely stamped over text (f. 81v).
The Persian word shanbah has been added above the text.
Lengthy untitled Arabic prayer for Sunday.
The Persian word yak shanbah has been added above the text.
The Persian word dū shanbah has been added above the text.
The Persian word sih shanbah has been added above the text.
Partially dated colophon (f. 136v): completed on Friday the day of burāʾat (shab-i burāʾat), 14 Shaʿbān (year not stated).
Notes giving special instructions for prayers on the eves of Friday and other select days of the week.
Arabic eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Persian note on the deferral of ritual prayers.
Persian note on the expression of intent or nīyat before commencing ritual or elective prayers.
Miscellaneous noted on prayer formulae and litanies.
Private utterance or munājāt attributed to the Prophet Muḥammad preventing poverty.

Notes on the benefits of reciting particular sūrahs of the Qurʾān, followed by a vifq al-aʿdād or numerological magic square used as a talisman or taʿvīz̲, finally concluding with a slightly modified version of the Nādi ʿAlī prayer.
Untitled Persian notes on a tradition related by Shaykh Abū Ilyās of a quatrain or rubāʿī recommended for recitation.
Persian eulogy or durūd appealing for the aid of the Prophet Muḥammad, written in an irregular qiṭʿah form.
Arabic eulogy or durūd to the Prophet Muḥammad.
Untitled Arabic spiritual genealogy of the Qādirīyah as late as the period of a certain Shaykh Bābā Muḥammad Ṭāhir.
The ninety-nine names of the Prophet Muḥammad (in naskh) with extensive Persian notes on authorities for the tradition transcribed in minute shikastah āmīz in the margins.
Persian notes introducing the virtues of a brief untitled Arabic prayer against destitution.
Untitled Persian eulogy or durūd praising and supplicating to the Prophet Muḥammad and earlier prophets, the caliphs, companions, Prophet Muḥammad’s wives, Sunnī scholars, and Sufi saints.
Brief notes on Arabic prayer formulae recommended by Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Jīlānī.
Untitled quotation of sūrat Muzammil from the Qurʾān (lxxiii).
Brief untitled Arabic prayer for curing headaches.
Fragment of an untitled Persian prayer.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Lengthy untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Persian notes explaining a brief Arabic prayer.
Untitled Persian mas̲navī in praise of the Prophet Muḥammad, written irregularly in two columns in varied orientations.
Untitled Persian notes on prophetic traditions relating to prayers read after ritual prayers.
Untitled Persian spiritual genealogy of the Chishtīyah as late as the period of Shāh Hidāyat Allāh, known as the Bāb Allāh.
Distinctive naskh with elements from the bihārī script.
Undated colophon (f. 212r): completed by Shaykh ʿAbd al-Ṣamad Ṣiddīqī.
Untitled quotation of the Āyat al-Kursī or the Throne Verse from the Qurʾān (ii: 255).
Untitled notes in Persian instructing on invocations to God in Arabic.
Untitled quotation of sūrat Yā Sīn from the Qurʾān (xxxvi).
Untitled quotation of sūrat Fatḥ from the Qurʾān (xlviii).
Untitled quotation of sūrat Vāqiʿah from the Qurʾān (lvi).
Untitled quotation of sūrat Mulk from the Qurʾān (lxvii).
Untitled quotation of sūrat Fātiḥah from the Qurʾān (i) followed by a lengthy Arabic prayer.
Untitled quotation of sūrat Nabāʾ from the Qurʾān (lxxviii) followed by a brief Arabic prayer.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian on the recommendation of Sayyid ʿAbd al-Qādir Jīlānī.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian relating its revelation as a divine gift to the Prophet Muḥammad through the angel Jibrāʾīl.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Brief untitled Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian on its recommendation attributed to the Sufi Ḥasan Baṣrī.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Arabic supplicatory utterances ascribed in preceding Persian notes to the Sufi Vays (Uvays) Qaranī (d. 37/657).
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Lengthy Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Rough shikastah āmīz with naskh for Arabic passages.
Untitled Arabic eulogy or durūd in praise of the Prophet Muḥammad, comprising the latter portion of Durūd Akbar.
Brief Persian ghazal by an unknown author.
Brief Arabic prayer preceded by notes in Persian.
Notes on the benefits of a vifq al-aʿdād or numerological magic square used as a talisman or taʿvīz̲.

provenance.p: Purchased by the Government of India at sale organised by Delhi Prize Agents, 1859; administrative deposit India Office Library, 1876

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact British Library, Registering for a Reader Pass. Contact apac-enquiries@bl.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript. For information on catalogues and ordering manuscripts see Finding and ordering Persian manuscripts in the British Library.

revisionDesc.change: Julian Cook 850 BL Persian mss prepared for initial publication in FIHRIST (plus 18 replacements)
